metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10269 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
BWA (aka Burrow-Wheeler Aligner) before 2019-01-23 has a stack-based buffer overflow in the bns_restore function in bntseq.c via a long sequence name in a .alt file. It was discovered that Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) mishandled certain crafted .alt files. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bwa - 0.7.17-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bwa package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.17-1ubuntu0.1').
